law.catch_line: Within 10 days after an offeror of architectural services or engineering services receives notice of...

text.section: Within 10 days after an offeror of architectural services or engineering services receives notice of a recommendation by the Selection Board to the Board of Public Works, the offeror may appeal the recommendation to the Board of Public Works.

On an appeal under this section, the Board shall:
approve the recommendation;
disapprove the recommendation; or
remand the matter to the Selection Board for further consideration.

The Board of Public Works may award a prospective offeror or an offeror the reasonable costs of filing and pursuing an appeal, not including attorney's fees, if:
the prospective offeror or offeror appeals the recommendation of the Transportation Selection Board or the General Selection Board to enter into an architectural services or engineering services contract to the Board of Public Works;
the Board of Public Works disapproves the recommendation of the Transportation Selection Board or the General Selection Board; and
the Board of Public Works finds that there has been a violation of the procurement law or regulations.
The Board of Public Works shall adopt regulations to implement this section and to determine what constitutes reasonable costs of filing and pursuing an appeal.
